snippet: Marion Cotillard, discussing her movie “Rust and Bone,” says of playing a woman who has just lost her legs, “I think that’s the gift of the actor, the ability to put ourselves in a state.”
abstract: Actress Marion Cotillard enjoys transforming herself into diverse characters, as she did for her Oscar-winning performance as Edith Piaf in 2007 and in her latest role as a woman who has lost her legs in the upcoming film Rust and Bone.
lead_paragraph: Marion Cotillard, discussing her movie “Rust and Bone,” says of playing a woman who has just lost her legs, “I think that’s the gift of the actor, the ability to put ourselves in a state.”

headline.seo: Marion Cotillard on ‘Rust and Bone,’ From Jacques Audiard
headline.main: Wrestling a New Role Into Its Full Rebirth
headline.print_headline: Wrestling a New Role Into Its Full Rebirth
